description:
Whether you ramble or run, stroll or stride, use a cane or a crutch, you'll find images of interest. Unless otherwise noted, the images are from the Prints & Photographs Division.

Browse moreÂ content that is free to use and reuse.
children.meta_description: Whether you ramble or run, stroll or stride, use a cane or a crutch, you'll find images of interest. Unless otherwise noted, the images are from the Prints & Photographs Division.

items.alt: Profile view of a woman walking a small dog briskly across an intersection with a car and traffic signal in the background. She is wearing a dress, heels, and a cloche-style hat.
items.title: Woman walking a dog, New York City. Photo by Angelo Rizzuto, 1958.

items.alt: Poster shows a woman walking vigorously on her own among trees and hills.
items.title: Hiking. By Shari Weisberg, 1930s.  WPA recreation project, Illinois.

items.alt: A laughing toddler stands in a circular device on wheels that allows the child to walk across the floor.
items.title: "Learning to walk." 1905.

items.alt: Very large crowd of women and men wearing racing numbers, running shorts, and sneakers as they sprint down the street.
items.title: Race for the Cure on Pennsylvania Avenue, Washington, D.C. Photo by Carol M. Highsmith, 1990.

items.alt: A man in a wheelchair rolls from the platform towards an open subway door.
items.title: Metro: subway facilities for handicapped, Washington, DC. By Thomas O'Halloran, 1977.

items.alt: Two people with their backs to the camera are walking down a road near a billboard that says "Next time, try the train. Relax."
items.title: Toward Los Angeles, California. By Dorothea Lange, 1937.

items.alt: Vertical blue flag on a pole in the sidewalk with a white silhouette of a man in a hat striding along with a cane in one hand.
items.title: Flag showing the silhouette of President Harry S. Truman walking with his cane marks a site along the Truman Historic Walking Trail in his hometown, Independence, Missouri. By Carol M. Highsmith, 2021.

items.alt: A woman supports a young boy with braces on both legs by holding his crutches under his arms. The boy looks down at a picture labeled "Puppies" on the floor.
items.title: A student nurse, acting as physical therapist, points to the picture book, thus encouraging this toddler to learn to use his crutches. By Fritz Henle, 1942.

items.alt: Photo shows a group of Black people as they walk down the street. Includes women carry signs for equal rights, integrated schools, decent housing, and an end to bias.
items.title: March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom, a civil rights demonstration in Washington, DC.  By Warren Leffler, 1963

items.alt: A line of Black men and women wearing "Freedom Now" shirts and a variety of shoes carry bags and backpacks as they walk in pairs down a street.
items.title: CORE members swing down Fort Hamilton Parkway, Brooklyn, toward 69th St. ferry on trek to Washington, DC. By O. Fernandez, 1963.

items.alt: Two women in traditional clothing walk barefoot along a dirt road.
items.title: Two women walking along a road in Sri Lanka.  By William Henry Jackson, 1895.

items.alt: One man pauses while walking across the ice beside a line of six dogs who are pulling another man in a sled.
items.title: Nanai men with dog sled on Amur River, Russia. By William Henry Jackson, 1895.

items.alt: The man wears a ragged shirt and looks at the camera while holding the hand of a young child wearing a dress and shawl. Both wear caps.
items.title: Man carrying sticks and walking with little girl in field of wild flowers. Around 1900.

items.alt: Several Black children walk by in pairs along a dirt road with trees in the background. Two are carrying jackets and sweaters in their arms.
items.title: "Bear Mountain, New York. Interracial activities at Camp Fern Rock, where children are aided by the Methodist Camp Service. Campers returning from a day's hike." By Gordon Parks, 1943.

items.alt: A young man stands on miniature, two-wheeled bicycle-like roller skates that are pedaled.
items.title: Roller skating. By Bain News Service, 1910.

items.alt: Women and men, mostly middle age, fill the sidewalk, moving in both directions, with stores in the background. A man at a mailbox is licking a stamp before mailing a letter.
items.title: 42nd St., New York City, telefoto from a bus. By Anthony Rizzuto, 1953.

items.alt: A series of 12 consecutive images showing the motions of a man walking while taking a straw hat off his head.
items.title: Man walking with a hat. By Edweard Muybridge, 1887. Plate 44 in Animal Locomotion.

items.alt: Several men in top hats use their feet striding along the ground to propel their bicycles along a roadway at a mile marker labeled "London 2 Miles".
items.title: The Hobby Horse, 1819. (Bicycles without pedals). London: Leadenhall Press, 1894.

items.alt: A young woman wearing a dress and a man in a suit are speeding along on bicycles with pedals on the front wheels
items.title: The Velocipede Belle Songster. New York, 1869. (American Folklife Center)

items.alt: A woman  sits in a chair inside a large bicycle wheel with two smaller wheels at the back on a country road.
items.title: View of Oldrieve's new tricycle, the New Iron Horse, with a lady inside, By Charles Oldreive, 1882.

items.alt: A man wearing ragged clothes strides along while a dog runs happily alongside him.
items.title: Caricature of old man walking and playing flute. (Music Division)

items.alt: Two men support the poles in front of the covered chair while two other men support the poles behind the chair.
items.title: Four men carrying sedan chair, China. By William Henry Jackson, 1895.

items.alt: Row of men, shown in profile, walking across a snowy field or frozen body of water.
items.title: Six men walking on snowshoes. By Stoddard, around 1890.

items.alt: A woman wearing a yellow coat pauses while walking dogs on a snow-covered slope with skiiers and trees in the background.
items.title: Ann Bonfoey Taylor walking three West Highland White Terrier dogs, Vail, Colorado. By Toni Frissell, 1967.

items.alt: Two men in army uniforms wear a long floating device on each foot while gliding upright across a river or lake. One man carries a rifle and the other man is pulling a soldier who lies flat across two of the floating devices.
items.title: "Walking on Water" demonstration. By Warren Leffler, 1962.

items.alt: Women in long skirts and head scarves are in the foreground with men and boys wearing shorts and sneakers are in the background with a roller coaster in the distance.
items.title: Patrons stroll among the rides at King's Island theme park in Mason, a suburb of Cincinnati, Ohio. By Carol M. Highsmith, 2016.

items.alt: Smiling young woman is wearing a picture hat and a long red dress. She raises her slim skirt above her ankles while walking, which shows the bottom of her ruffled petticoat.
items.title: "Taking a stroll." By Hamilton King, 1907.

items.alt: Four men with leg or foot injuries use wooden crutches to participate in a race down a road with barrack-like buildings in the background.
items.title: U.S. General Hospital No. 1. Crutch race for patients. By American Red Cross, 1919.

items.alt: A one-legged soldier in uniform is supported by crutches attached to a belt. He is throwing a rock at a sign showing the face of the Kaiser.
items.title: "New legs for old. Tommy with new belt-crutch, can pelt the Kaiser to his heart's delight." By American Red Cross, 1917-1920.

items.alt: Man in uniform stands with crutches and stares into the camera. His right leg is amputated above the knee.
items.title: Private Richard T. Gilbert of Co. D, 18th Georgia Infantry Regiment on crutches after losing his leg at the Battle of Gettysburg in 1863.

items.alt: A man and woman wearing large backpacks and holding walking sticks pose with their dog along the wooded trail.
items.title: Three expert hikers pose on the Appalachian Trail near Damascus, Virginia. Photo by Carol M. Highsmith, around 2000.

items.alt: Brown metal sign shows two hikers in silhouette wearing backpacks and walking sticks.
items.title: Crossing sign for the iconic Appalachian Trail, in this case a portion near Bartlett, New Hampshire. By Carol M. Highsmith, 2017.

items.alt: A man carrying a bed roll over his shoulder walks along the side of a road. Other people in the background are also walking away from the camera.
items.title: "The trek of bums, tramps, single transients and undesirable indigents out of Los Angeles County because of police activity." California. By Dorothea Lange, 1936.

items.alt: Crowd of Black men, women, and children stands on the bridge. One woman holds a sign that reads "National Voting Rights Museum. Celebrate the right to vote with annual bridge crossing jubilee."
items.title: 45th Anniversary of the Civil Rights March from Selma, Alabama to Montgomery, Alabama. Photo by Carol M. Highsmith, 2010.

items.alt: A crowd of women wearing large hats and long dresses and men wearing suits and straw boaters stroll together.
items.title: "On the board walk, Long Beach, N.Y." By Ambrose Fowler, 1912.

items.alt: Long line of men walking up a snow-covered, steep hill carrying heavy packs.  Seen from behind.
items.title: "Klondikers starting up "The Golden Stair," Chilkoot Pass, Alaska." By Keystone View Co., 1898.

items.alt: The woman pushing the stroller wears knee-length shorts, and the other woman is wearing a knee-length dress.
items.title: Back view of two women walking on sidewalk while toddler in stroller looks back towards the photographer. By Anthony Rizzuto, 1959

items.alt: Poster showing a man falling to the ground after being struck by a car. A policeman runs towards the man.
items.title: "Don't jay walk. Watch your step." By Isadore Posoff, 1936 or 1937.

items.alt: Three white men and a Black man are running fast while a crowd looks on.
items.title: "New York City. The fifth contest for the long-distance pedestrian championship of the world, at the Madison Square Garden. A spurt for the lead." 1879.

items.alt: Two young children in traditional Chinese clothing stand in the middle of the sidewalk while a man walks another child up the hill towards them.
items.title: Returning home, Chinatown, San Francisco. By Arnold Genthe, 1896-1906.

items.alt: Cover illustration shows two men in athletic outfits  striding along a road while onlookers cheer them on.
items.title: "The Young Pedestrian. Containing clear instructions how to train and prepare for long walks, coupled to which is a record of all the great pedestrian contests up to date." New York, 1882. (General Collections)

items.alt: Crowds line both sides of the street to watch men running by in athletic outfits with individual ID numbers.
items.title: "Start, Brooklyn marathon." By Bain News Service, 1909.

items.alt: Poster shows the profile of a man walking sedately in a park-like setting with large trees behind him and bushes in the foreground.
items.title: Hiking. By Beard, 1939. WPA recreation project, Illinois.

children.title: Free to Use and Reuse: Walking

description:
Weddings are celebrated throughout the year, but June is a favorite month. This selection of rights-free pictures highlights brides and grooms from many different customs and countries in the 18th to the 20th century.

Browse moreÂ content that is free to use and reuse.
children.meta_description: Weddings are celebrated throughout the year, but June is a favorite month. This selection of rights-free pictures highlights brides and grooms from many different customs and countries in the 18th to the 20th century.

items.title: Wedding March. Sheet music by John Philip Sousa, 1918. Music Division

Art plus diplomacy. Washington, D.C. Photo by Harris and Ewing, 1939. Prints & Photographs Division

Marriage Evening. Print by Currier & Ives,  1860s. Prints & Photograph Division
Come, haste to the wedding. Song sheet by H.D. Marsan, 1860. Music Division
Godey's fashions for December 1861. Fashion plate from Godey's Lady's Book. Prints & Photographs Division
Fairy Wedding Group. "General Tom Thumb" and Mercy Lavinia Warren Bump. Photo by Mathew Brady Studio, 1863. Prints & Photographs Division
Marriage at the camp of the 7th N.J.V. Army of the Potomac, Virginia. Drawing by Alfred R. Waud, March 18, 1863. Prints & Photographs Division
Marriage Certificate for Murray D. Lamson and Alvina B. Burrill with oval cut outs for photographs. Drawing by H.B. Stockwell, 1871. Prints & Photographs Division
Tajik wedding rituals: wedding gifts. Photograph in TurkestanskÄ«Ä­ alÊ¹bom, 1871-1872. Prints & Photographs Division
Domestic Sewing Machine. Print by W.J. Morgan & Co, 1882. Prints & Photographs Division
James A. Garfield Papers: Series 21, Additions, 1775-1889; 1980 Addition; Family papers; Stanley-Brown, Mary Garfield; Wedding announcement, Joseph Stanley-Brown, 1888. Manuscript Division
Wedding picture. Photo by W.J. Hazenstab, 1894. Prints & Photographs Division
Hopi Bridal Costume. Photo by Edward S. Curtis, 1900. Prints & Photographs Division
June Flowers. Cover illustration drawn by Rose O'Neill for Puck magazine, 1905. Prints & Photographs Division
A Chinese Bride and Groom. Stereograph photo by Keystone View Co., 1905. Prints & Photographs Division

Photograph with caption âEskimo wedding ... Alaska." St. Michael was a trading post for the Yupâik people, established by the Russian-American Company in 1833. Here Alaska Natives traded goods for Western supplies such as much of the clothing in this image. Photo by Huey and Laws, 1906. Prints & Photographs Division
President Roosevelt, with Alice Roosevelt-Longworth and Hon. Nicholas Longworth in bridal array. Stereograph photo by Charles L. Wasson, 1906. Prints & Photographs Division
Sealing Their Bliss. Stereograph photo by Sterro-Photo Co., 1907. Prints & Photographs Division
She was led to the altar. 1908. Prints and Photographs Division
Wedding Bells. Sheet Music by J. Fred Helf and Robert F. Roden, 1909. Music Division
Warning to royal brides. Do not marry him if the seal is broken. Cover illustration by Samuel D. Ehrhart for Puck magazine, 1913. Prints and Photographs Division
The Wedding (kittens). Photo by Harry Frees, 1914. Prints & Photographs Division
Breese wedding. Photograph by Arnold Genthe, 1915. Prints & Photographs Division
Let the Chimes of Normandy be our Wedding Bells. Sheet Music by F. Henri Klickmann and Paul B. Armstrong, 1918. Music Division
Wedding Bells: Will You Ever Ring for Me? Sheet music by Jean Schwartz, Sam M. Lewis, and Joe Young, 1918. Music Division
Soldier's Usual Sweet Aspirations. Sheet music by Henry J. Martin, 1919. Music Division
Polish Bride and Groom. Photograph for the American National Red Cross, 1920. Prints & Photographs Division
Bridegroom's first view of his future wife, Chosen, Korea. Stereograph photo by Keystone View Co., 1920. Prints & Photographs Division

Better[?] Ole Wedding. Photo by National Photo Company, 1921 or 1922. Prints & Photographs Division

Florida Senator and bride on way to opening session (Senator and Mrs. Claude Pepper). Photo by Harris & Ewing, 1937 Jan. 5. Prints & Photographs Division

description:
A wide variety of housing throughout the United States appears in this set, including rural, town, and city dwellings that date from the 1800s to the present. Unless otherwise noted, the images are from the Prints & Photographs Division.

Browse moreÂ content that is free to use and reuse.
children.meta_description: A wide variety of housing throughout the United States appears in this set, including rural, town, and city dwellings that date from the 1800s to the present. Unless otherwise noted, the images are from the Prints & Photographs Division.

items.alt: Row of 4-story buildings along a busy city street.
items.title: Small shops line the street below upstairs apartments in the El Barrio neighborhood,  New York City. 2010s.

items.alt: Overview of a farm house, barn, and outbuildings with a green field in the foreground.
items.title: M. Miller Farm,  Sharpsburg, Maryland, built early 1800s.

items.alt: Eight people sit at a formally set table with their heads bowed.
items.title: Dr. Mordecai Johnson, president of Howard University, saying grace before Thanksgiving dinner, Washington, DC. 1940s.

items.alt: A woman uses the long handle of a water pump to get water for her toddler who holds a mug beneath the spout.
items.title: The Friends' new home had been vacant for many years, but they plan to rebuild, Albion, New York vicinity. 1940s.

items.alt: Exterior view of a large, elaborate, stone mansion.
items.title: "The Breakers," Cornelius Vanderbilt II house, Newport, Rhode Island, built 1890s.

items.alt: Low wood building painted across the whole front with a stylized animal face and paws.
items.title: Chief's painted house with totem pole, deserted Tlingit Indian village, Cape Fox, Alaska, July 1899.

items.alt: Interior room with large window, a bookshelf, several chairs, and a coffee table.
items.title: Brooklyn Convalescent Home, Far Rockaway, New York. 1950s.

items.alt: In a furniture-crowded room a girl crochets while a boy holds the ball of yarn. A man reads a newspaper and an old woman sits on the bed.
items.title: Home-work (crochet) in East Side Tenement home, New York City. 1910s.

items.alt: Interior view of an elegant living room with a colorful  conversation pit
items.title: Miller house, Columbus, Indiana. Designed by architect Eero Saarinen, 1950s.

items.alt: A young man rests on wood crates arranged like a chair along a city street.
items.title: "Comforts of home" in the Bowery. 1950s.

items.alt: A one-story,  u-shaped, earth-toned house surrounds an open area with a tree and bushes.
items.title: Adobe architectureâthe  Kromer House, built in Los Ranchos de Albuquerque in the early 1900s.

items.alt: Front view of a 3-story, Victorian style house with a tower, many windows,  and porches.
items.title: Harper House, Centreville, Maryland, built 1880s.

items.alt: A woman in a polka dot dress holds a kettle above a wood-burning cast iron stove; pots and pans hang on the paper-covered wall.
items.title: New Madrid County, Missouri. Kitchen of a sharecropper house. 1930s.

items.alt: Two one-story cottages with front porches on a tree-lined street.
items.title: King William Street (Houses), San Antonio, Texas, built 1880s.

items.alt: A roof top pool with a man swimming in the water and others sunbathing by the pool.
items.title: New apartments, Washington, DC, 1960s.

items.alt: A woman sits comfortably on a couch in her living room. On her lap is a bulky set of papers.
items.title: Toni Morrison, author, at her upstate New York home. 1980s.

items.alt: Two multi-story Victorian houses tilted at about a 15-degree angle with people walking along the street.
items.title: "After the earthquake - frame houses tumbled from their foundations, San Francisco," California, 1907.

items.alt: Room with a flat-top desk and chairs in front of two windows and  bookshelves along the wall.
items.title: Model home interior, 1870s.

items.alt: Several large trees, including a palm tree surround a 2-story family home with a long front porch.
items.title: Orange grower's home, Ormond, Florida. 1890s.

items.alt: Drawing shows a small, one-story beach house with an open-wall front and back, raised on poles with two cars parked underneath.
items.title: Walker guest house, Sanibel Island, Florida. By architect Paul Rudolph, 1952.

items.alt: Exterior view of a one-story cabin with windows. The name on the barge is "Edward Hedger".
items.title: "Cabins on canal barges are home to many a family. Erie Canal, New York." 1940s.

items.alt: A man stands just inside the screen door of a small, plain single family home.
items.title: Oswego, New York. A home in the Polish section. 1940s.

items.alt: A man works at a table in a small room while a boy sits in a narrow space set off by floor-length, flower-patterned curtains.
items.title: Rolling cigarette cases in tenement home, New York City. 1910s.

items.alt: A young child, covered by a coat with fur trim, rests his head on a pillow. A carved wood chair is in front of the bed.
items.title: A boy sleeping at his home on East 62nd Street, New York City. 1930s.

items.alt: Three young, smiling, and cheerful women sit on cots in a tent with a wood floor.
items.title: Girls from Richwood, West Virginia, in their tent home, Batavia, New York. 1940s.

items.alt: A brick building with a sign on an awning that reads, "The Haberdashery Lofts." Above the awning is an image of a smiling man tipping his hat.
items.title: Part of the old Paramount Theatre building in Clarksdale, Mississippi, became loft apartments.  2010s.

items.alt: Cars are parked along a street of an industrial town, with railroad tracks in the foreground. A line of brick homes are in the background.
items.title: Workers' homes. Little Falls, New York. 1940s.

items.alt: Long rectangular two-story brick buildings with many windows sits along railroad tracks. A tall smokestack is in the background.
items.title: Old mills, slowly converting to residential apartments, in Asheboro, North Carolina. 2010s.

items.alt: A group of young people dressed in coats walk along the street. A young woman holds an American flag and others carry signs that say, "We don't want to burn" and "Five children burnt in the 7th St. fire."
items.title: "Children's protest parade. They want better homes." New York City, 1930s.

items.alt: Two young girls are sitting on a carpeted floor intently playing a game with a piano in the background.
items.title: "Chinese-American playing Chinese checkers with her Jewish friend in Flatbush home." New York City, 1940s.

items.alt: Two 4-story sand-colored buildings with a snow topped mountain and evergreen trees int he background.
items.title: Condominiums at a ski resort in Summit County, Colorado. 2010s.

items.alt: Entrance with four archways and the text "Bird Park Apts" along the top. Decorative tiles adorn two of the arches.
items.title: Apartments on Santa Catalina Island, California. 2010s.

items.alt: Sign says "Apartments" in big block letters and has the shape of the state of Idaho, along with the text "Idaho" and a Vacancy notice.
items.title: The Idaho Apartments neon sign in Pocatello, Idaho. 2020s.

items.alt: Signs attached to a building says "Swimming Pool" and "Pueblo Hotel and Apartments." A figure of a woman in a bathing suit is above the signs.
items.title: Vintage "diving girl" sign on the Pueblo Hotel and Apartments Building in Tuscon, Arizona. 2010s.

items.alt: Front and side view of a small shack with slanted roof, front porch, wood covers for the door and windows. Clothes are hanging on a line.
items.title: "Home of Negro sharecropper, near Port Barre, Louisiana." 1930s.

items.alt: A set of colorful multi-story buildings with stadium scoreboard and lighting in front of them.
items.title: Loft apartments that overlook the baseball stadium in Lansing, Michigan. 2010s.

items.alt: Two-story apartment building with a fenced pool in the foreground. The orange apartment doors open directly to the outside.
items.title: Apartments, Hollywood Beach, Florida. 1990s.

items.alt: A dug-out hillside in a small, rural town. Small wood houses are nearby.
items.title: Modular/Mobile architecture for public housing, Vicksburg, Mississippi. Designed by Paul Rudolph in the 1960s.

items.alt: A 2-story, square structure is under construction for two housing units. A ladder leans on the side of the building
items.title: Modular/Mobile architecture for public housing, Vicksburg, Mississippi. Designed by Paul Rudolph in the 1960s.

items.alt: A graphic illustration shows a transparent building in the shape of a dome. Behind the grand entrance with footmen are tiny rooms too small for both the owners and the servants
items.title: "All is not gold that glitters," 1903.

items.alt: A bare-chested man is pulling on a chain, with a tall factory in the background. In the foreground is a small, one-story house.
items.title: "Welcome - defense workers! Homes registration office ...," 1941.

items.alt: The sod blocks are visible in this one-story house with a slanted roof and a 12-pane window.
items.title: Nebraska sod house, 1909.

items.alt: Drawing shows a long and short mobile home connected by an enclosed entry area with steps; each structure has many small windows.
items.title: Proposal for modular housing (prefab aluminum). Designed by architect Charles Goodman, 1940.

items.alt: Old man in overalls sits in a chair looking into a very large fireplace. Light comes in through cracks between the large logs.
items.title: William Morris Log Cabin, Saluda, Polk County, North Carolina. 1930s

items.alt: Front view of a wide, two-story house, with beige-colored bricks and red tile roof.
items.title: Dana-Thomas House in Springfield, Illinois. A Prairie School-style house designed by architect Frank Lloyd Wright, early 1900s.

items.alt: Three dimensional drawing of a modular home, with numbers to signify different sections of the construction.
items.title: Modular/Mobile architecture for public housing, Vicksburg, Mississippi. Designed by Paul Rudolph in the 1960s.

children.title: Free to Use and Reuse: Where We Live

description:
Winter scenes from cold-weather and warm-weather locations fill this set of images from the 1600s to the present. Unless otherwise noted, the images are from the Prints & Photographs Division.

Browse moreÂ content that is free to use and reuse.
children.meta_description: Winter scenes from cold-weather and warm-weather locations fill this set of images from the 1600s to the present. Unless otherwise noted, the images are from the Prints & Photographs Division.

items.alt: Two long rows of smiling snowmen figures, lit from within, are each wearing a black hat, green gloves, and red and green scarf while holding a candy cane.
items.title: Festive snowmen at the Cornerstone Sonoma shopping complex in Sonoma County, California. Photo by Carol M. Highsmith, 2012.

items.alt: Illustration shows four styles of coffee or hot chocolate pots.
items.title: "Caffetiere de diverses formes."  Illustration in Le bon usage du thÃ©, du caffÃ© et du chocolat, by Nicolas de Blegny, 1687, p. 155. (Rare Book Division)

items.alt: Print shows travelers walking up a steep pass on a snow-covered hillside.
items.title: Kameyama, TÅkaidÅ Japan. Color woodcut by AndÅ Hiroshige, between 1833 and 1836.

items.alt: Young girl in a beige coat with a hood holds a bouquet of red-leafed plants.
items.title: Girl with poinsettia. Print published by the Union Pacific Tea Co., 1908.

items.alt: Illustration shows the details of an open poinsettia flower surrounded by red and green leaves.
items.title: "Poinsettia pulcherrima." Illustration by Samuel Holden in: Paxton's Magazine of Botany. London : W.S. Orr, 1838, v. 4, opp. p. 97.  (General Collections)

items.alt: Waves break on a sandy beach beneath a blue sky with palm trees in the background.
items.title: North Shore beach, Oahu, Hawaii. Photo by Carol Highsmith, December, 2005.

items.alt: One man and two women are holding hands while ice-skating in front of the Lincoln Memorial.
items.title: Ice skating at Lincoln Memorial, Washington, D.C. Photo by Harris & Ewing, 1922.

items.alt: Illustration shows a snowy cottage in front of a small pond surrounded by holly berries.
items.title: "In Winter's Embrace." Pillow cover, 1907.

items.alt: Poster shows a women, wearing a long black dress and matching hat with hands inside a large muff, standing next to snow man with a broom, top hat, and corn-cob pipe.
items.title: "Winter." Poster by  Penrhyn Stanlaws, 1907

items.alt: Long line of dogs pulling a sled in the snow in front of several log buildings.
items.title: Dog sled arriving in Knik Alaska and carrying gold from Iditarod. January 12, 1912.

items.alt: A man in the foreground stands in the street and speaks through a paper megaphone. Two boys near him hold a young goat and live chicken. Men and children watch from the sidewalk.
items.title: Christmas raffle in the streets of Cidra. The kid and chicken are the prizes. Puerto Rico. Photo by Edwin Rosskam, 1937.

items.alt: Children and some adults are walking up the middle of a snow-covered hill in a city and sliding down the side of the hill. An icy arch in the background has '1999' on it.
items.title: Theater Square, ice hill for 1999 New Year's celebration, Arkhangelsk, Russia. Photo by William  C. Brumfield, 1998.

items.alt: Photo shows people atop a snow plow as it moves along a railroad track in a snowy landscape.
items.title: Snow Plow of the Central Pacific R.R. Company, near Cisco, California. Photo by Lawrence & Houseworth, 1866.

items.alt: Print showing the frozen falls at Niagara Falls.
items.title: "Niagara in Winter." Print by Edward Burrill and Murdock Bros., 1874.

items.alt: A firework show above snowy mountain with evergreen trees.
items.title: A spectacular fireworks show caps off the "Warmth of Winter" exhibition at the annual Winter Carnival in Steamboat Springs, Colorado. Photoby Carol M. Highsmith, February 2016.

items.alt: A winter scene with people ice skating on a river, a woman feeding chickens on snow-covered ground in front of a house, and people walking towards a church in the background.
items.title: "Winter." Print by Joseph Morviller and L. Prang & Co., 1869.

items.alt: A woman sits cross legged on the ground as she creates snow shoes out of wood and twine by hand.
items.title: "The Snow Shoe Maker." Photo by Gordons, early 1900s.

items.alt: Several people are standing on skis in front of large houses or hotels and a snow-covered mountain in the background.
items.title: "Midwinter in the PyreneesâSkiing." Stereograph by Underwood & Underwood, 1915.

items.alt: Illustration shows a red train passing through the snow-covered keystone logo of the Pennsylvania Railroad, which is decorated with a giant holiday wreath.
items.title: "Season's Best Way to Travel. Pennsylvania Railroad." Poster, around 1955.

items.alt: Poster shows Uncle Sam and Lady Liberty escorting a winged New Year's baby with the year 1919 on a sash.
items.title: "World peace with liberty and prosperityâ1919. Happy New Year." World War I poster, 1918.

items.alt: Poster shows a woman wearing a fur stole and a long dark dress walking towards the viewer. One hand is in a muff and the other hand holds her hat on her head.
items.title: "Century: Midwinter Fiction Number." Poster around 1900.

items.alt: Illustration shows activities on a snowy day. A large sleigh drawn by four horses carries several men and women past a large house with a white picket fence. Vignettes showing people ice skating, sledding, and making snowballs.
items.title: "Winter Days." Published by Gaylord Watson and Tenney & Weaver, 1881

items.alt: Four men in knit caps and long coats stand next to a small wood shack and sip cups of soup. Lanterns, barrels, and crates sit next to the shack.
items.title: Soup-house for ice-cutters. Photo by Bain News Service, 1910s.

items.alt: Illustration shows a black cat wearing a collar with a "5 cents" charm facing the viewer.
items.title: "The Black Cat, December." Magazine poster, around 1900.

items.alt: Illustration shows a child pulling a sled full of books toward a house.
items.title: "January--A year of good reading ahead." Poster for the W.P.A. Library Project in Illinois, 1936-1941.

items.alt: A row of shivering children sitting at the edge of a body of water with their feet dangling in the water. All appear to be cold, wrapping their arms around themselves, and some are smiling.
items.title: Japanese winter bathers. Photo by Bain News Service, 1926 Feb. 19.

items.alt: Photo shows a row of seven reindeer each pulling small sleds. Three people accompany the reindeer, holding their reins.
items.title: Reindeer, sleds and drivers. Photo, early 1900s.

items.alt: Illustration shows three men fishing through holes cut in the ice on a frozen body of water in a snow covered landscape with a house in the distance. A basket full of fish  is in the lower left foreground.
items.title: "Winter sports - Pickerel Fishing." Print by Currier & Ives, 1872.

items.alt: Photo shows a man sawing a block of ice from a frozen body of water in front of a row of boat houses.
items.title: Ice harvesting, sawing. Photo by Detroit Publishing Co., 1900 - 1910.

items.alt: Photo shows a man on ice skates gliding across a body of ice as he holds a kite behind him and has a basket on his arm.
items.title: Ice sailing. Photo by Bain News Service, 1910-1915.

items.alt: Photo shows a child standing at the base of a large weather gauge.
items.title: U.S. Weather Bureau. Snow gauge. Photo by National Photo Co., 1909-1920.

items.alt: This print shows eight men posing in fall and winter clothing. They wear long coats and top hats or derby hats and  also carry canes. In the top corners, examples of different vests are shown.
items.title: "Modern Fashions. Fall & Winter." By Rude & Son, 1905.

items.alt: This print shows ten women posing in suit jackets and long skirts. They wear large brimmed and feathered hats and also carry purses. The back views of their outfits appear at the bottom of the print.
items.title: "Gentlewomen's Fashions, Autumn and Winter." By Croonborg Sartorial Co., 1911.

items.alt: A man in a colorful sport shirt poses by an outdoor pool in the sunshine and looks down at a hand-held camera.
items.title: Sporting Look, Florida. Photo by Toni Frissell, December 1954.

items.alt: Two women pose outdoors in outfits that feature shorts, a blouse, and flat shoes.
items.title: Sporting Look, Florida. Photo by Toni Frissell, December 1954.

items.alt: Snow and icicles are on leafless woody plants with their limbs attached to a trellis on a brick wall.
items.title: Vines in winter. Photo by Carol M. Highsmith, around 2000.

items.alt: A man on a tall lift is lighting the far right candle flame. A sign reads "Happy Chanukah."
items.title: Lighting the thirteen-foot-tall menorah during the annual community Chanukah celebration in Oklahoma City. Photo by Carol M. Highsmith,  2020.

items.alt: Man with a fluffy beard portrays Santa Claus. He is wearing a wool hat and coat with a fur collar and cuffs, lightly dusted with snow.He looks directly into the camera.
items.title: "Santa Claus." Photo copyrighted in 1895.

items.alt: Illustration shows a large ice palace in the center with  men wearing snow shoes walking in a torchlight procession in the foreground. People ice skating and sledding are in the background.
items.title: Montreal Winter Carnival, February. By A. Major, 1884.

items.alt: This print shows many people, often in pairs, riding toboggans down a large, icy street. Other people line the street, dragging their sleds back up to the top of the bridge. To the left, large houses are in the distance. To the right, horses wait with sleighs.
items.title: Advertisement for Star Toboggans. Print by Phoenix Litho, 1886.

description:
These images depict a diversity of work in America, as found across collections generated by theÂ American Folklife Center's field survey projectsÂ between 1977 and 1998. In urban and rural communities--and in settings encompassing traditional occupations, small businesses, factories, and natural resource management--you will find in these photographs a wide range of people engaged in jobs that contribute to economies, individual identities, and cultural communities.

children.title: Free to Use and Reuse: Work in America

description:
During World War I, the impact of the poster as a means of communication was greater than at any other time during history. The ability of posters to inspire, inform, and persuade combined with vibrant design trends to produce thousands of interesting visual works.

Explore this selection and view more WWI posters.

Browse more content that is free to use and reuse.

description:
Notable authors in a variety of fields appear in this set along with people who overcame challenges in writing. You'll find connections to novelists, poets, historians, philosophers, reformers, scientists, a mystery writer and a horror fiction king. The National Book Festival web site is a good place to find videos by contemporary authors. Unless otherwise noted, the images here are from the Prints & Photographs Division.

Browse moreÂ content that is free to use and reuse.

You'll find connections to novelists, poets, historians, philosophers, reformers, scientists, a mystery writer and a horror fiction king. The National Book Festival web site is a good place to find videos by contemporary authors. Unless otherwise noted, the images here are from the Prints & Photographs Division.

items.alt: Colorful illustration of Sequoyah wearing a head scarf, smoking a pipe, and holding a tablet covered with Cherokee letters.
items.title: Sequoyah holding the syllabary he created for writing the Cherokee language. Portrait print by John T. Bowen, 1838.

items.alt: Helen Keller sits in profile at a desk with her hands on a typewriter.
items.title: Helen Keller at desk with Braille typewriter. Portrait photo by UPI, 1919.

items.alt: Toni Morrison sits at a desk and poses for a photographic portrait. Her hands rest on an open notebook.
items.title: Toni Morrison, at her upstate New York home. Portrait photo by Bernard Gotfryd, 1980s.

items.alt: A manuscript page with printed lines of poetry and handwritten edits by Walt Whitman.
items.title: Letter and corrected reprint of Walt Whitman's "O Captain, My Captain" with comments by author, 9 February 1888. (Manuscript Division)

items.alt: Walt Whitman sits in profile for a photographic portrait wearing a hat and balancing an artificial butterfly on his finger.
items.title: Walt Whitman, with a butterfly on his finger. Portrait photo by Phillips & Taylor, 1873.

items.alt: James Baldwin sits for a photographic portrait with his arms crossed on his lap. The folds of a backdrop are visible behind him.
items.title: James Baldwin. Portrait photo by Carl Van Vechten, 1955.

items.alt: Colorful illustration of Harry Ludlowe sitting at a desk holding a quill pen and looking up at a large raven. The apparition of a woman hovers behind him.
items.title: Mr. Henry Ludlowe in The Raven, the love story of Edgar Allan Poe. Theater poster by U.S. Lithograph Co., 1908.

items.alt: Seuss sits at a desk for a photographic portrait and holds open a book titled âThe Cat in the Hat.â A shelf holding rotary phones and books is behind him.
items.title: Dr. Seuss (Ted Geisel) seated at desk with Cat in the Hat and other books he wrote. Portrait photo by Al Ravenna, 1957.

items.alt: The gate of a wrought iron fence in the shape of a spider web is accentuated with metal bats and situated in front of a large Victorian house.
items.title: Stephen King's house, Bangor, Maine, with bats on the gate. Photo by Carol M. Highsmith, 2017.

items.title: Zora Neale Hurston, beating a drum. Portrait photo by New York World-Telegram & Sun staff, 1937.

items.alt: Cartoon illustration of Mark Twain standing in profile while speaking on a stage to a laughing audience. Flying books are visible behind him.
items.title: Mark Twain, America's best humorist. Caricature by Joseph Keppler, 1885.

description:
These portraits of Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Americans represent people who made a difference in many careers and time periods. LGBTQ+ Pride Month is often recognized in June. Unless otherwise noted, the images are from the Prints & Photographs Division.

Browse moreÂ content that is free to use and reuse.
